reviewText: Although this isn't a history channel production with a history channel budget, the content of this series is outstanding. What I appreciate are the stories of early black figures who are rarely mentioned in American history. The episodes are less than 30 minute, which leaves enough time for discussions. We are viewing this series at the Senior Retirement home where I work. It has been extremely popular. I recommend this series as an educational tool for all ages.
This documentary series was full of great information and well put together. I highly recommend it for classroom use or personal use.
The recipient states this is VERY informative & WELL WORTH the price.
Informative and exactly what I expected.  The variety of historical icons will make a great addition to my person history collection.
My kids and I are using this as a Black History study tool. The video is well narrated and enjoyable to watch.

My DVR broke so I thought I'd take the time to look at some of the many dvd's I have in my collection.  This set, although a bit tedious in its presentation (repetitive uninspiring music, uninspiring host....), has solid information and a short video clips so that you can sit for the entire session or watch over a series of small periods of time (i.e. if you are watching with younger children).  The video format is also user friendly a school environment.  I learned a great many details from this set - so many that I've recommended that other people borrow and\or buy it.  Just make sure you don't let the presentation style scare you off.  It is worth your time!
